Description: Fragment of floor and lower part of rim of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; low ring foot with triple grooving on its inside; raised band at edge of floor below rim; interior: whitish slip; traces remaining of rim decoration; on the band, frieze of alternating solid squares and cross-and-dot motifs separated by triple verticals; at edge of floor, black band with added red and white bands; to the centre, on left, the face and top of head (with red hat) of a figure facing right; on the right are three branches and one smaller branch; exterior: black band on lower part of rim; reserved groove below; underside, slipped: resting surface and inner and outer ridge glazed, rest reserved; glaze at break to the centre.
Curator's comments: Probably belongs with GR 1888.6-1.551 (analysed as Teian) and GR 1888.6-1.552, where the branches are closely similar.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1023)
Condition: Are the scored edges and possible plaster remains indicative of C19 reconstruction?
